page.title: 19LOCAL HISTORY-HOUSES
page.content: CARY FITZPAINE is mentioned in the original Domesday Book-'Robert holds Cary(Fitzpaine)from Roger.Two thanes held it before 1066:it paid tax for 1 hide,less 1 furlong.Land for one plough which is there,in lordship, with 4 cottagers. Meadow 20acres.10 cattle;9 pigs.The value was,and is,20s.' This was anciently a manor place of some consequence and it would appear to have had its own chapel of which there are now no traces.It was probably rebuilt early in the 19th.century and is an admirable example of local village building with its walls of coursed lias rubble and pyramidal slate roof.The deep eaves,the panelled windows with keyblocks and the metal verandah are all typical of the period.It is still the farmhouse of a working farm.
